MAY 2008 MARIN COUNTY EMS GPC 6A
ccmmaa ccmmaa
STATE OF CALIFORNIA STATE OF CALIFORNIA
CALIFORNIA CALIFORNIA
MEDICAL ASSOCIATION MEDICAL ASSOCIATION
NOTE TO PHYSICIANS ON INVOLVEMENT WITH EMT-Is AND PARAMEDICS NOTE TO PHYSICIANS ON INVOLVEMENT WITH EMT-Is AND PARAMEDICS
A life support team (EMT-II or Paramedic) operates under standard policies and procedures A life support team (EMT-II or Paramedic) operates under standard policies and procedures
developed by the local EMS agency and approved by their Medical Director under Authority of developed by the local EMS agency and approved by their Medical Director under Authority of
Division 2.5 of the California Health and Safety Code. The drugs they carry and procedures Division 2.5 of the California Health and Safety Code. The drugs they carry and procedures
they can do are restricted by law and local policy. they can do are restricted by law and local policy.
If you want to assist, this can only be done through one of the alternatives listed on the back of If you want to assist, this can only be done through one of the alternatives listed on the back of
this card. These alternatives have been endorsed by CMA, State EMS Authority, CCLHO and this card. These alternatives have been endorsed by CMA, State EMS Authority, CCLHO and
BMQA. BMQA.
Assistance rendered in the endorsed fashion, without compensation, is covered by the Assistance rendered in the endorsed fashion, without compensation, is covered by the
protection of the A Good Samaritan Code@ (see Business and Professional Code, Sections protection of the A Good Samaritan Code@ (see Business and Professional Code, Sections
2144, 2395-2298 and Health and Safety Code, Section 1799.104). (over) 2144, 2395-2298 and Health and Safety Code, Section 1799.104). (over)

MAY 2008 MARIN COUNTY EMS GPC 6A
ENDORSED ALTERNATIVES FOR PHYSICIAN INVOLVEMENT ENDORSED ALTERNATIVES FOR PHYSICIAN INVOLVEMENT
After identifying yourself by name as a physician licensed in the Sate of California, After identifying yourself by name as a physician licensed in the Sate of California,
and, if requested, showing proof of identity, you may choose one of the following: and, if requested, showing proof of identity, you may choose one of the following:
1. Offer your assistance with another pair of eyes, hands or suggestions, but let the 1. Offer your assistance with another pair of eyes, hands or suggestions, but let the
life support team remain under base hospital control; or, life support team remain under base hospital control; or,
2. Request to talk to the base station physician and directly offer your medical 2. Request to talk to the base station physician and directly offer your medical
advice and assistance; or, advice and assistance; or,
3. Take total responsibility for the care given by the life support team and physically 3. Take total responsibility for the care given by the life support team and physically
accompany the patient until the patient arrives at a hospital and responsibility is accompany the patient until the patient arrives at a hospital and responsibility is
assumed by the receiving physician. In addition, you must sign for all instructions assumed by the receiving physician. In addition, you must sign for all instructions
given in accordance with local policy and procedures. (Whenever possible, remain given in accordance with local policy and procedures. (Whenever possible, remain
in contact with the base station physician) in contact with the base station physician)
(REV. 7/88) 88 49638 Provided by the EMS Authority (REV. 7/88) 88 49638 Provided by the EMS Authority
